sense.name: restrict or limit the range of
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] CONFINE NP2[abstract] (to NP3[extent])
sense.examples: Please confine your essay to 2,000 words. The experiement was confined to 3 hours.

sense.name: close within bounds; deprive of freedom
sense.examples: This prison mainly confined the prisoners of war. The owner can take animal from the person who confined it. An opening was made in the lower end of the glen that confined the water.
